nodes.bodyText: Copyright Check would fail instead, right?
It's the only change in this file, so the copyright doesn't need to be updated.
Probably I touched it somehow, but then reverted the change. In any case I can revert it.
It's policy to keep existing tracepoint numbers the same, meaning that older tracepoint can't be deleted. They can be updated with the Obsolete keyword.

nodes.bodyText: Copyright Check would fail instead, right?
It's the only change in this file, so the copyright doesn't need to be updated.
Probably I touched it somehow, but then reverted the change. In any case I can revert it.
I believe _cacheletCntr, _cacheletTail, _cacheletHead, _runningNested, _growEnabled, _isSerialized a few lines above can be removed.
The trace point Trc_SHR_CM_readCache_initCacheletFailed can be marked as Obsolete at j9shr.tdf.
This trace point can also be mark as Obsolete in j9shr.tdf.
This trace point can be mark as Obsolete.
This trace point can be mark as Obsolete.
This trace point can be mark as Obsolete.
This trace point can be mark as Obsolete.
There is another #if defined(J9SHR_CACHELETS_SAVE_READWRITE_AREA) at line 3954 (or line 3796 with your change) which can be removed.
Trc_SHR_CMI_primeHashtables_addingHint and Trc_SHR_CMI_primeHashtables_failedToPrimeHint can be marked as Obsolete
The above #if defined(J9SHR_CACHELETS_SAVE_READWRITE_AREA) and code inside it can also be removed.
There is one more #if defined(J9SHR_CACHELETS_SAVE_READWRITE_AREA) above in the function at line 2799 (or line 2676 with your change)
You can remove the flag J9SHR_RUNTIMEFLAG_ENABLE_NESTED in shcflags.h and make a comment there say bit 0x10000 is free to use. All the code checking this flag can also be removed.

nodes.bodyText: Nothing is changed in this file. So no need to update the copyright date.
This change is still in this PR. Seems that you didn't push your local change to your personal fork ?

Wanted to push one more commit right away, but then decided to rework it.
I was reorganizing commits to make the history prettier. But replies were already posted.
Sorry for the confusion.
No need to update the copyright date.
